member.name: M:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.Extensions.TypeExtensions.GetInterfaceMethods(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets a collection of all methods declared by the interface or any of its base interfaces.
member.param: An interface type.
member.returns: A collection of all methods declared by the interface or any of its base interfaces.

member.name: T:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.GreedyMockConstructorQuery
member.summary: Selects appropriate constructors to create instances.

member.name: M:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.GreedyMockConstructorQuery.SelectMethods(System.Type)
member.summary: Selects constructors for the supplied type.
member.param: The mock type.

remarks.para: This method only returns constructors if is a type. If not, an empty sequence is returned.

If the type is the type of a constructed , constructors are returned according to the generic type argument's constructors. If the type is an interface, the default constructor is returned. If the type is a class, constructors are returned according to all the public and protected constructors of the underlying type. In this case, the constructor that takes a params array is returned for each underlying constructor, with information about the appropriate parameters for each constructor.

member.name: T:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.MockConstructorQuery
member.summary: Selects appropriate constructors to create instances.

member.param: The mock type.

remarks.para: This method only returns constructors if is a type. If not, an empty sequence is returned.

If the type is the type of a constructed , constructors are returned according to the generic type argument's constructors. If the type is an interface, the default constructor is returned. If the type is a class, constructors are returned according to all the public and protected constructors of the underlying type. In this case, the constructor that takes a params array is returned for each underlying constructor, with information about the appropriate parameters for each constructor.

member.name: T:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.MockRelay
member.summary: Relays a request for an interface or an abstract class to a request for a of that class.

member.name: M:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.MockRelay.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.MockRelay.#ctor(Ploeh.AutoFixture.Kernel.IRequestSpecification)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specification that determines whether a type should be mocked.
member.param: A specification that determines whether a type should be mocked or not.

member.name: P:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.MockRelay.MockableSpecification
member.summary: Gets a specification that determines whether a given request should be mocked.

remarks.para: This specification determines whether a given type should be relayed as a request for a mock of the same type. By default it only returns for interfaces and abstract classes, but a different specification can be supplied by using the overloaded constructor that takes an as input. In that case, this property returns the specification supplied to the constructor.

member.summary: Creates a new specimen based on a request.
member.param: The request that describes what to create.
A context that can be used to create other specimens.
member.returns: A dynamic mock instance of the requested interface or abstract class if possible; otherwise a instance.

member.name: T:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.MockVirtualMethodsCommand
member.summary:
Sets up a mocked object's methods so that the return values will be retrieved from a fixture, instead of being created directly by Moq.
This will setup any virtual methods that are either non-void or have "out" parameters.
member.remarks:
This will setup any virtual methods that are either non-void or have "out" parameters. This includes: - interface's methods/property getters; - class's abstract/virtual/overridden/non-sealed methods/property getters.
Notes: - Due to a limitation in Moq, methods with "ref" parameters are skipped. - Automatic mocking of generic methods isn't feasible either - we'd have to antecipate any type parameters that this method could be called with.

member.summary: Sets up a mocked object's methods so that the return values will be retrieved from a fixture, instead of being created directly by Moq.
member.param: The mock to setup.
The context of the mock.

member.name: T:Ploeh.AutoFixture.AutoMoq.StubPropertiesCommand
